responses.text: The Toronto Maple Leafs are a professional ice hockey team in the NHL.
They play their home games at Scotiabank Arena in downtown Toronto.
The team's colors are blue and white, and fans love to watch them in fall and winter.
Many fans collect Maple Leafs trading cards and sort them by player and year.
The team has changed coaches several times over the years.

Toronto_Maple_Leafs.text: The Toronto Maple Leafs are a professional ice hockey team based in Toronto. They compete in the NHL as a member of the Atlantic Division.
Toronto_Maple_Leafs.title: Toronto Maple Leafs

Scotiabank_Arena.text: Scotiabank Arena is a multi-purpose indoor arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is the home of the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Scotiabank_Arena.title: Scotiabank Arena

Hockey_card.text: A hockey card is a type of trading card relating to ice hockey, usually printed on cardboard or thick paper.
Hockey_card.title: Hockey card

responses.text: Cloud computing is a technology that stores data on remote servers accessed via the internet.
Companies like Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure provide cloud storage solutions.
The cloud makes it easy to share files and work from anywhere in the world.
Many businesses are moving their data to the cloud for better security.
Cloud services can scale up or down based on how much storage you need.

Cloud_computing.text: Cloud computing is the on-demand availability of computer system resources, especially data storage and computing power.
Cloud_computing.title: Cloud computing

Amazon_Web_Services.text: Amazon Web Services is a subsidiary of Amazon that provides on-demand cloud computing platforms.
Amazon_Web_Services.title: Amazon Web Services

Microsoft_Azure.text: Microsoft Azure is a cloud computing service operated by Microsoft for application management.
Microsoft_Azure.title: Microsoft Azure

Cloud_storage.text: Cloud storage is a model of computer data storage in which data is stored on remote servers.
Cloud_storage.title: Cloud storage

Scalability.text: Scalability is the property of a system to handle a growing amount of work by adding resources.
Scalability.title: Scalability

responses.text: The Scripps National Spelling Bee is a famous competition held every year.
Children study word lists and practice spelling difficult words to compete.
The competition takes place in Washington D.C. and is broadcast on television.
Winners receive a trophy and prize money for their spelling achievements.
Some past winners have gone on to become doctors and scientists.

Scripps_National_Spelling_Bee.text: The Scripps National Spelling Bee is an annual spelling bee held in the United States.
Scripps_National_Spelling_Bee.title: Scripps National Spelling Bee

Spelling_bee.text: A spelling bee is a competition in which contestants are asked to spell a broad selection of words.
Spelling_bee.title: Spelling bee

responses.text: The book 'How to Eat Fried Worms' is a popular children's novel from 1973.
In the story, a boy makes a bet that he can eat 15 worms in 15 days.
The book was made into a movie in 2006 that kids enjoyed watching.
Many schools include this book in their reading lists for young students.
The story teaches lessons about friendship and keeping your word.

How_to_Eat_Fried_Worms.text: How to Eat Fried Worms is a children's book by Thomas Rockwell, published in 1973 about a boy who bets he can eat 15 worms.
How_to_Eat_Fried_Worms.title: How to Eat Fried Worms

How_to_Eat_Fried_Worms_(film).text: How to Eat Fried Worms is a 2006 American children's comedy film based on the 1973 book of the same name.
How_to_Eat_Fried_Worms_(film).title: How to Eat Fried Worms (film)

responses.text: Hibernation mode on computers puts the system into a low-power state.
When you hibernate your laptop, it saves everything to the hard drive and shuts down.
This is useful when you want to save battery but keep your work open.
To wake up from hibernation, you just press the power button.
Many people use hibernation instead of sleep mode for longer periods of inactivity.

Hibernation_(computing).text: Hibernation is a power management feature that saves the contents of RAM to a hard disk and powers down the computer.
Hibernation_(computing).title: Hibernation (computing)

Sleep_mode.text: Sleep mode is a low power mode for electronic devices that reduces power consumption while maintaining state.
Sleep_mode.title: Sleep mode
